resources.string: <thinking>Hmmm...
<no>A building is already being relocated.
Let's get that finished and then we can think about moving another one, okay?
Wait! It looks like we're already working on your house!
Make sure you place all the items needed for costruction into the construction box infront of your tent.
Wait! It looks like we're already working on your house!
Make sure you place all the items needed for costruction into the construction box infront of your house.
As soon as construction is completed, we'll see what we can do to make your house bigger. <glee>
Afternoon, <PlayerName>!
Take it easy.
What a bloody beautiful arvo.
Don’t you think, <PlayerName>?
Hooroo!
What a bloody beautiful arvo.
Don’t you think, <PlayerName>?
Hooroo!
Hello there, <PlayerName>.
What can I do for you?
I want to apply for a licence
Lets talk about the town
About my house...
Lets chat
Nevermind.
Alright then...
Let's see...
Let's take a look.
Have a great day.
<no>Oh, that building is currently being upgraded.
<yes>Let's get that finished before we try and move it!
Ah, you've changed your mind?
Not to worry!
<shy> Oh, you really shouldn’t have, <PlayerName>.
<yes>I’ll tell you what, it means a lot that you even remembered it was my <birthday>!
<glee>You’ve made an old lady very happy today.
<shy>Thank you very much, <PlayerName>.
<haha>I’ll tell you what, you’re always helping me out!
<glee>Here’s a reward, please take it!
Okay, so we're going to apply for the <deedName>?
Just so you know, this will put the town in <deedDebtAmount> in debt.
Oh don't worry, we will pay it off in no time! <pumped>
There is a donation box here in the Base Tent.
So are we going to apply for the <deedName>?
Let's do it!
Not right now.
Great! We're all set. I'll give you the deed so you can decide where to place it.
Once it's placed, check the deposit box on the build site.
We won't be able to start construction until we have all the required materials.
So the quicker we have everything we need, the quicker we can start construction!
Not a worry!
Please come see me if you change your mind!
So, you wanted to talk about your home?
<glee> I'll tell you what, I’m so glad you’ve decided to accompany me on this adventure, <PlayerName>.
<worried> I was starting to think no one in <SouthCity> was brave enough to join me!
<haha>When you were the first and only person to respond to my ad, I knew you were the right person for the job!
<no>Oh dear, look at old <myName> waffle on...
Let's get cracking, <PlayerName>!
I'll see you outside, okay?
I want to upgrade
I want to move my house.
Nevermind
Hmmm...
Oh, <PlayerName>.
<glee>The <Snags> are ready, and I've got one with your name on it.
<shock>Looks like your pockets are full.
<no>Clear out some room, then come back and so you can dig in.
Righto, <PlayerName>.
<glee>These <Snags> are ready to go!
<proud>Trust me, it’s an old family delicacy.
Now, what type would you like?
Meat Snag
Veggie Snag
Surprise me!
Righto.
Now, I’ve actually made this <Snag> just for you, <PlayerName>.
<yes>I put a lot of love into this <Snag>.
It’s just a way of saying thanks for everything you’ve done for me this past year.
Not to mention everything you’ve done for <IslandName>.
I hope you like it, mate.
<shy>Now go and enjoy the <Snag> and the rest of <IslandDay>.
<glee>You’ve bloody earned it!
Righto.
Now, I’ve actually made this <Snag> just for you, <PlayerName>.
<yes>I put a lot of love into this <Snag>.
It’s just a way of saying thanks for everything you’ve done for me this past year.
Not to mention everything you’ve done for <IslandName>.
I hope you like it, mate.
<shy>Now go and enjoy the <Snag> and the rest of <IslandDay>.
<glee>You’ve bloody earned it!
Righto.
Now, I’ve actually made this <Snag> just for you, <PlayerName>.
<yes>I put a lot of love into this <Snag>.
It’s just a way of saying thanks for everything you’ve done for me this past year.
Not to mention everything you’ve done for <IslandName>.
I hope you like it, mate.
<shy>Now go and enjoy the <Snag> and the rest of <IslandDay>.
<glee>You’ve bloody earned it!
<NPCName> brings so much life to the place.
I bloody love it!
Is it just me, or can <NPCName>’s prices seem a bit steep?
Sure is nice being able to buy some fruit every once in a while though.
<yes>Even if it does grow everywhere, it’s more convenient.
I like how much <NPCName> gets done.
That man really moves.
<thinking>He could probably spend a little less time in his head though...
<yes>I'll tell you what, <NPCName> is actually younger than me.
<haha>But you’d never know that by talking to him!
That <NPCName> girl sure is pretty.
She has some… strange ideas, too…
I really like that <NPCName> fella.
That man has so much energy!
Rayne brings so much life to the place.
I bloody love it!
<yes><NPCName> really knows his stuff.
It’s been nice having someone to talk to about <Licences> and <PermitPoints>.
That man gets it.
<NPCName> can be really cold-hearted at times.
It’s nice being able to store my <Dinks> somewhere safe though, that’s for sure!
<PlayerName> here to see old <myName>?
Hooroo.
<PlayerName>!
What brings you to see old <myName>?
Have a good one!
I’ll tell you what, it’s always nice to bump into you, <PlayerName>.
Need anything?
<yes>Righto.
I’ll tell you what, it’s bloody lovely to see you, <PlayerName>!
Hope I see you again today!
Well, would you look at this. It’s only <PlayerName>!
What can I do for you?
Always lovely chatting with you!
Well, would you look at this. It’s only <PlayerName>!
What can I do for you?
Always lovely chatting with you!
Wait! It looks like we're moving your house.
<yes>We should get that all done before we start trying to upgrade it.
<thinking>Hmmm...
<no>Your house is currently in the proccess of upgrading.
Let's get that finished and then we can think about moving it after, okay?
G’day, <PlayerName>.
Hope you’re enjoying yourself .
What day is it?
What's this surprise?
Talk to you soon
Well, tomorrow will actually mark the <timeSinceArriving> since you and I arrived here on <IslandName>.
<proud>So in honour of our time spent here, I named today <IslandDay>.
<shy>I’ll tell you what, time goes quickly when you’re my age.
<no>I can’t believe how much <IslandName> has grown since then.
<IslandDay> is a day to celebrate <IslandName> and how far we’ve come.
<glee>And not to mention all the new friends we’ve made!
So I hope you will stick around and join us as we ring in our next year here on <IslandName>!
<haha>I’m not telling you!
I’ll tell you what, you’ll have to wait for the sun to go down.
Don’t forget that I’ve still got a surprise for everyone tonight!
<glee>Plenty of <IslandDay> left to celebrate.
G’day, <PlayerName>.
It’s <IslandDay> today, so I’m chucking a <SnagSizzle> for us all.
What day is it?
Can I have a Snag?
Talk to you soon
Well, tomorrow will actually mark the <timeSinceArriving> since you and I arrived here on <IslandName>.
<proud>So in honour of our time spent here, I named today <IslandDay>.
<shy>I’ll tell you what, time goes quickly when you’re my age.
<no>I can’t believe how much <IslandName> has grown since then.
<IslandDay> is a day to celebrate <IslandName> and how far we’ve come.
<glee>And not to mention all the new friends we’ve made!
So I hope you will stick around and join us as we ring in our next year here on <IslandName>!
You’ll have to hold your horses.
It takes a bit to cook a good <Snag>.
<no>Not to mention how many different sorts I’ve got to cook for everyone here.
<shy>I’ll tell you what, some of the folks here on <IslandName> can be picky eaters.
<haha>Myself included!
<yes>The <Snags> will be ready around noon.
So make sure you're back here at lunch time!
Righto!
<yes>The <Snags> will be ready around noon.
So make sure you're back here at lunch time!
Until then, enjoy yourself today, <PlayerName>.
Oh, <PlayerName>!
How do you like the show in the sky?
<shy>I had a little help getting it ready.
You should be able to see them all over <IslandName> for the rest of the night.
Feel free to go wandering and check them out from your favourite spots here on <IslandName>.
Thanks for today.
Talk to you soon
I’ll tell you what, no need to thank me!
Everyone here tonight should be thanking you!
You’ve done an amazing job, bringing everyone on <IslandName> together and helping us all find a new home.
I’m honoured that you came with me on the <AirShip> all that time ago.
<glee>Here’s to another beautiful year on <IslandName>.
Righto, <PlayerName>.
<yes>Enjoy your night.
<glee>Here’s to another beautiful year on <IslandName>.
G’day, <PlayerName>.
It’s <IslandDay> today, so I’m chucking a <SnagSizzle> for us all.
What day is it?
Got anymore Snags?
Talk to you soon
Well, tomorrow will actually mark the <timeSinceArriving> since you and I arrived here on <IslandName>.
<proud>So in honour of our time spent here, I named today <IslandDay>.
<shy>I’ll tell you what, time goes quickly when you’re my age.
<no>I can’t believe how much <IslandName> has grown since then.
<IslandDay> is a day to celebrate <IslandName> and how far we’ve come.
<glee>And not to mention all the new friends we’ve made!
So I hope you will stick around and join us as we ring in our next year here on <IslandName>!
Sorry mate, they’re all gone!
I’ll tell you what, it looks like they were a big hit.
We’ll have to do this again next year, right?
Oh, and there is a surprise later on tonight, <PlayerName>.
<glee>Plenty of <IslandDay> left to celebrate.
Oh, and there is a surprise later on tonight, <PlayerName>.
<glee>Plenty of <IslandDay> left to celebrate.
Ah, <PlayerName>.
How can I help you?
Oh, okay then.
G'day, <PlayerName>.
What did you need?
<no>No worries.
Hi, <PlayerName>.
Can I help you?
Hooroo !<wave>
Nice to see you, <PlayerName>.
Do you need anything?
See you in a bit!
How’s it going, <PlayerName>?
<yes> Alright, I’ll see you later.
<haha>I’ll tell you what, I was just thinking of you, <PlayerName>!
Can I help you with something?
Take care.
Morning, <PlayerName>.
Take it easy, okay?
<proud>I’ll tell you what, it’s a lovely morning today.
<wave>Enjoy your morning!
Good morning, <PlayerName>.
<yes>See you around.
Alright, we can move your house for <sprite=11>25,000.
Does that sound okay?
Let's do it!
No thanks.
Great! I'll take the <sprite=11>25,000 and you take this deed and place it where you want your house.
<thinking>You're probably going to want to sleep somewhere else tonight. Maybe outside?
<yes>Now these movers are quick, but they can be very rough...
<yes>They'll try their best to put your furniture back where they found it, but sometimes they can get it all jumbled up.
Maybe some other time, hmm?
<no>I can’t see anything in this murk.
Is that you, <PlayerName>?
Good night!
Good evening, <PlayerName>.
Don't stay up too late, okay?
Hooroo.
Another day coming to an end.
<yes>I’ll tell you what, they go fast at my age!
Nighty night, <PlayerName>.
Oh! <shocked>
It appears we dont have any deeds avaliable right now!
I hope we can apply for some more soon!
But you don't have a house yet! If you ask my about deeds we might be able to solve that.

string.name: FLETCH/No Room In Inv Building Move 1_Intro_000

resources.string: <no>You don't have any room to hold the move deed!

string.name: FLETCH/No Room In Inv Building Move 1_Intro_001

resources.string: <yes>Please, make some room and come and talk to me.
It looks like your house is as big as it can be for now! <haha>
Hmmm. <thinking>
<no>I don't think you have room to hold any deeds.
<yes>Please make some room and come back again.
<no>I'm sorry, <PlayerName>.
<shy>Only perminant residents can move buildings
<thinking>Just about lunchtime, I think.
Righto.
G’day <PlayerName>.
Enjoying your day?
<wave>Hooroo.
Noon already?
I’ll tell you what, today is going quick!
Enjoy the rest of your day, <PlayerName>.
Oh, I think we'll leave that up to people that live here, okay?
Alright, we can move your house for <sprite=11>25,000.
Does that sound okay?
Let's do it!
No thanks.
<shy>Oh, it seems like you can't afford to move it right now...
That's alright, just come and ask me again when you can, okay?
Okay, here are our current deeds.
Hmmm... <thinking>
I don't think it would be wise to apply for more deeds with the town in debt. <no>
People can donate money at a donation box here in the base tent.
Slowly but surely we will reach our goal! <pumped>
I’ll tell you what, I really enjoy chatting to you, <PlayerName>.
It’s probably because you don’t talk as much as I do! You really know how to listen.
I wanted...
Actually...
I’ll tell you what! You’re a true blue friend, <PlayerName>.
I’ll tell you what! You’re a true blue friend, <PlayerName>.
How lucky is it that <favouriteFood> grows natively here on <IslandName>!
<glee><favouriteFood> is my favourite food! I bloody love them!
I’m a very lucky lady, I’ll tell you what!
<IslandName> has changed a lot, I’ll tell you what!
<thinking>But then again, I have too...
<pumped><PlayerName>, let’s do our best to make <IslandName> a great place people want to live!
I moved to <SouthCity> when I was a very little girl.
<no>I’ll tell you what, it was hard to make friends at that age.
<haha>None of the other kids had a clue what I was talking about most of the time!
<yes>I’ll tell you what, as more people move here, the more it starts to feel like the <IslandName> I remember.
<pumped>I’ll tell you what, if we keep working hard, <IslandName> will be a place everybody wants to live!
Although I lived in <SouthCity> most of my life, it never did feel like home there.
<haha>I’ll tell you what the place was chock-a-block full of houses though!
I wish I could help you out more, <PlayerName>.
<no>I’ll tell you what, old <myName> wasn’t always old.
<pumped>I used to run around helping people out, just like you do.
<yes>I was always doing something.
<IslandName> has a lot of different ecosystems for such a small area.
If I remember correctly, my old home was located on the near North-West coast… Or maybe it was South-East?
<thinking>Hmmm…
I’ll tell you what, when I remember, I’ll let you know.
I’ve held onto that <Journal> I gave you for years back in <SouthCity>.
<sigh>It’s the only thing I have to remind me of my Father...
<no>Oh, it’s okay, don’t worry.
<glee>It warms my heart to see you beating those milestones!
<yes>I think it would warm his heart too.
Ah, I see you’ve already started to make a dent in those milestones.
<no>Don’t worry, <PlayerName>, I’ve got plenty more <PermitPoints> to hand out.
I’ve been saving all my life.
<haha>I’ll tell you what, the only <Licence> I ever needed was the <Licence> to give <Licences>!
I’ll tell you what, I really enjoy chatting to you, <PlayerName>.
It’s probably because you don’t talk as much as I do! You really know how to listen.
I wanted...
Actually...
I’ll tell you what! You’re a true blue friend, <PlayerName>.
I’ll tell you what! You’re a true blue friend, <PlayerName>.
<thinking>I know we’re a long way from <SouthCity> and I could probably just hand out all your <Licences> to you straight away...
<no>But let me tell you, <PlayerName>, you’re not going very far in life unless you work hard to get what you want!
I’ll tell you what, I used to dream of becoming a <Nomad>. You know, getting out of <SouthCity>, exploring the world...
<shocked>Oh!
<haha>I guess that's exactly what we did!
<glee>It just goes to show you’re never too old for a change!
<yes>Let me tell you, even though I hate doing it, I’m bloody grouse at paperwork.
<shy>It’s just something I picked up quickly in <SouthCity>.
<haha>I guess it made me look like I was a local!
<yes>I’ll tell you what, if you wanted to do something in <SouthCity>, you needed a form to do it.
Have a think about which <PermitPoints> you want to spend first.
I’ll tell you what, you look like somebody that’ll nab all of them.
There’s some that will make things much easier!
Hey <PlayerName>. You know, <myName> is actually my surname, right?
What’s your first name?
Why does everyone call you that?
<thinking>Hmmm…
<haha>I’ll tell you what, I might tell you one day...
<yes>Everyone called my Father <myName>. It was just easier.
<haha>I guess the name just stuck on me too!
<pumped>There’s so much for us still to discover here on <IslandName>!
<glee>I can’t I just can’t wait to hear all about it.
<no>You really should sleep more often <PlayerName>, it’s no good to run around with low energy!
I'll tell you what, why not take the rest of the day off?
You know what I hated most about <SouthCity>?
<no>The terrible, terrible food they have there.
<BlobFish>? Forget about that!
<no>I’ll tell you what, those things tasted like wet cardboard.
<haha>Except wet cardboard has more texture!
Thank you for looking after my Father’s <Journal>.
<proud>I’ll tell you what, some of those milestones will be tough to beat!
<yes>But take your time, <PlayerName>.
<glee>I’m sure you’ll reach them eventually!
I’ll tell you what, it’s just really nice to get out and about every once in a while, eh?
<proud>Exercise really gets my blood pumping!
<thinking>The animals on <IslandName> aren’t quite the same as I remember them ...
<yes>I guess so much has happened since then .
For all of us .
I don’t know why there’s so little motivation in <SouthCity>.
Why people don’t have a sense of adventure or passion.
<yes>I suppose those that do just don’t last long there ...
I’ll tell you what, if I were younger...
<haha>I still don’t think I’d be able to do all the things you do, <PlayerName>!
I'll tell you what, <PlayerName>.
<pumped>We’ve been getting on like a house on fire!
<shy>Thanks for keeping on keeping on, you little rascal you.
I’ll tel you what, you can stand around all day waiting for something to happen…
<proud>Or you can get out there and get it done!
<yes>I like that about you, <PlayerName>.
<haha>I tell you what, you’ve been getting it done.
I’ll tell you what, age has a funny way of sneaking up on you.
If you keep yourself busy and focused, you don’t notice it happening at all!
<haha> I remember catching my reflection once and thinking “Who’s this old lady in my house?”
For a long long time I felt like I was just treading water and waiting for something big to happen.
<no>You really can’t be like that though.
<thinking>Not if you want to be happy.
<proud>You have to MAKE things happen yourself!
<yes>Give yourself a goal, a purpose!
<pumped>Beat those milestones!
It’s funny how things change when you get older...
<shy>I look back at times I felt embarrassed, and they just make me chuckle now.
Things I cared about so much can just seem silly.
Time can really put things into perspective, don’t you think?
The rough stuff gets sanded over, but the bright stuff shines even brighter!
I’ll tell you what, saving up for all these years, I would have never imagined seeing <IslandName> look like this again.
<yes>While it’s not exactly how I remember it, it feels nice knowing that <IslandName> is someone's home again.
I think my Father would be very proud of what we’ve done here, <PlayerName>.
<haha>But I’ll tell you what, I’m very proud of what you’ve done here!
<yes>It’s always so nice to see you <PlayerName>.
<shy>I’ll tell you what, if I don’t get to talk to you at least once a day, I feel like I’ve missed out!
<sigh>I really wish you could have met my Father, <PlayerName>.
<haha>He would give you a run for your money, let me tell you!
<glee>It felt like that man could never run out of energy!
You’re the best thing that ever happened to me, <PlayerName>.
Sometimes I keep myself up late at night imagining that someone else responded to that ad...
<worried>Oh, no!
<no>But I’ll tell you what, there is no point in thinking like that!
<haha>You’re here, and that’s all that matters!
My father always used to say: “You keep your friends close, and your best friends closer.”
<haha> He wasn’t much of a wordy, but he knew how to get things done, make no mistake.
<yes>Always looking out for his friends, he was.
<yes>Just like you <PlayerName>.
Ah! So, you're interested in applying for a house deed?
I'll just let you know there is a <getHousePrice> up front fee. <thinking>
Oh, and once you've applied for the deed, you will have to source the construction materials yourself. <yes>
So, are you interested in applying for a house of your own?
I want to apply for a house.
Nevermind.
Well, I'll let you have a think about it.
Let me know if you change your mind.
I want to upgrade
I want to move my house.
Nevermind
Hmmm...
Alright then, <PlayerName>.
Can I see the deeds?
I want to move a building.
Nevermind.
Lets see what we can do...
Talk again soon, okay?
<thinking>Moving the building can be a bit expensive...
<yes>Let's get that town debt payed off before we move any buildings, okay?
Although this isn’t the <IslandName> I remember, it's still amazing seeing the changes you’ve made around here <PlayerName>.
I think my father would be proud of us!
Remember back when you were setting tents up for us both?
Look at <IslandName> now!
You’ve done such a good job, I’ll tell you what!
Oh, <PlayerName>.
I’ll tell you what, it really warms my heart to see <IslandName> bustling again.
Things are really shaping up around here, thanks to you!
<no>I would have never imagined seeing <IslandName> looking like this again..
<boohoo>You’ve really made an old woman very happy, <PlayerName>.
Thanks for everything you’ve done, <PlayerName>!
Very good!
...Oh. It seems like you a bit short on cash. <shy>
Perhaps you can come back when your pockets are a bit heavier?
Well, to make your house bigger its going to cost <getHousePrice> . How does that sound?
Yes!
Maybe later.
Very good!
...Oh. It seems like you a bit short on cash. <shy>
Perhaps you can come back when your pockets are a bit heavier?
Well, if you change your mind, please come speak to me.
Alright I'll take <getHousePrice> from you.
You'll find the construction material box in front of your house.
As soon as it's full you'll find the construction will be completed over night.
Don't worry. I hire very quiet workers. You won't hear a peep out of them! <haha>
I hope you're looking forward to your new house! <glee>
Well, to make your house bigger its going to cost <getHousePrice>. How does that sound?
Yes!
Maybe later.
Okay. We'll set up a construction box infront of your house. <yes>
We wont be able to start construction until you fill the box with the required construction materials. <yes>
As so you as have all the required materials, construction can begin!
Well, if you change your mind, please come speak to me.
So we're going to relocate <relocateBuildingName>?
Relocating the building will put the town <sprite=11>25,000 in debt.
Is that okay?
Let's move it!
Nevermind...
Ok! Lets do it!
Here is the <itemName>. Place it down in the new place we want the <relocateBuildingName>.
<yes>The building will be moved over night.
Not a problem, <PlayerName>.
The <PaperLantern> event has started, <PlayerName>!
<glee>Please go enjoy yourself!
How do I play?
Any tips for me?
Bye for now!
Well, the aim of the game is to hit down as many <PaperLanterns> from the sky as you can!
Each one will drop a <itemName> once you’ve hit it!
<haha>The best way to hit them down is using your <Kite>, but I won't stop you from being creative.
You should bring any <itemName> back here to this table to claim rewards from the reward box.
Good luck, <PlayerName>!
Well, if you stand still, you’ll notice the <Kite> will go wherever you’re looking.
If you “use” your <Kite>, you’ll let out some string and the <Kite> will go much higher.
It’s easier to aim your <Kite> while doing this and standing still.
<thinking>When I was a bit younger, I found this the best strategy:
Get close to a <PaperLantern>, “use” your <Kite> to let out some string to make the <Kite> go higher.
Then, try to line things up by watching where your <Kite>’s string is.
<yes>With a bit of practice, I’m sure you’ll get the hang of it <PlayerName>!
Good luck, <PlayerName>!
Happy <SkyFest> to you, <PlayerName>!
I've got some great activities planned for today, so I hope you'll stick around!
What day is it?
What activities?
Talk to you soon
Today is <SkyFest>!
You see, today is the day where we’ll see the <Aurora>!
<yes>It’s a very rare occurrence, even here on <IslandName>.
<glee>So, today we’re celebrating the sky with some fun activities while we wait.
<glee>I hope you’ll join in too, <PlayerName>.
Well, around 11:00 everyone will be making a <Kite>!
Be sure to come talk to me around 11:00 to get your <itemName>.
<proud>I’ve got enough for everyone!
<glee>A bit later on, we’ll start the <PaperLantern> event.
<yes>I’ll explain how that works a bit later.
And of course, everyone is looking forward to the main event.
The <Aurora>!
A beautiful and rare natural occurrence, later tonight.
Righto!
Don’t forget to come back a bit later to get your <itemName>!
Until then, enjoy yourself, <PlayerName>.
<glee>The <Aurora> is in full swing!
<glee>We should be able to see it all night here on <IslandName>.
<shy>I hope you’ve had some fun today, <PlayerName>.
The prize box will be here in the Band Stand all night, but the lanterns will stop once it gets late.
<yes>So make sure you try and get as many tickets as you can before then!
<haha>Hopefully the <Aurora> won’t distract you too much!
Have you made your <Kite> yet, <PlayerName>?

Oh, hey <PlayerName>. Did I ever tell you why we had to leave <IslandName> all those years ago?
You see, growing up, I didn’t even know the world had gone south!
<yes>Everything had always been okay here on <IslandName>.
My family and I had everything we needed. This place was our home and we all had each other.
<thinking>Until one day, when we had a big scare.
You see, some people arrived from <SouthCity> in some <AirShips>. They told us we needed to evacuate <IslandName>.
<no>They said a big <Shift> was coming, and the whole island was going to be ripped apart.
<worried>I’ll tell you what, I remember my Father was so scared.
<no>So we packed our whole lives up. Everyone did.
Next thing we knew, we were living in <SouthCity>.
They told us we could come back once the <Shift> had ended, and the island was safe again...
<sigh>But then my Father got crook…
Oh, crikey!
<haha>I’ll tell you what, old <myName> can jibber-jabber.
<shy>I’m feelin better now! Thanks for listening, <PlayerName>.
I’ll tell you what, I think my father would be so proud to see <IslandName> the way it is today.
He was a man that loved this island. It was very hard for him when we had to evacuate <IslandName>.
<no>He didn’t take well to the lifestyle in <SouthCity> at all.
<haha>He hated how you had to fill out a form to do everything!
He wanted to get back to <IslandName> as soon as possible.
<sigh>Unfortunately, the cold must have got to him.
<no>He got real crook, real quick.
<no>He never did get better.
<sigh>In the end I went to live with a family from <SouthCity>. They taught me the ways of life there.
<no>But I never did forget my Father.
You see, I had his journal. I knew the things the man had done.
Those milestones he’d reached.
